cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north on Sunday and then northeast, tracking up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England waters
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border, close to Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina and North Carolina coasts first, then Virginia, Maryland/Delaware, New Jersey and southern New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (8%) of sustained tropical-storm–force winds; more likely breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 kt Tuesday as the remnants pass offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port; surge of 1–2 ft limited to the Carolinas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Tuesday with locally higher amounts, could cause brief ponding on terminals and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated swells Tuesday may disrupt pilot boarding and container operations on exposed berths.
